Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: NSTraveller493
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. I find good value in the SpringHill brand and this property did not disappoint. I find the SpringHill accommodations are really not suites, but large rooms and this property would be the same. When I think of a suite I think of the dictionary definition - " a connected series of rooms to be used together" but in the SpringHill's I find they are usually one big room laid out in sections - this was not any different. Having said that it was a large comfortable room and the "suite" with sink, fridge and microwave is very functional for an extended stay. What really impressed me were the Customer Service skills of the staff. All (and I mean all) greeted you with a good morning or a good evening and always a smile. It was close to Fairmont quality Customer Service and that for me, says a lot. There were very attentive to any needs and the breakfast area was always spotless. They were always replacing offerings and constantly cleaning. Even the manager got in the act when the place was busy. My benchmark is the cleanliness of the liquid waffle machine ( a gooey concoction found these days in most complimentary breakfast offerings) - normally a mess at most hotels. This was consistently the cleanest and most attractive ever experienced. The hotel is close to the Metro Mall and it offers a wide variety of places to eat in the evening. I had no issues at all with noise despite the proximity to Interstate 17. A well managed property where people genuinely care - a hotel I would stay at again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Petty decent place”
Reviews.Author: capoppy55
Reviews.Content: This hotel has soothing turquoise and green colors throughout. The room surprised me with their kitchen/office area; sitting area (with a sofa bed if needed); and the sleeping area (we had 2 queen beds). Nicer than I was expecting. Plus free wi-fi. Breakfast was the usual ho-hum with cereal, bagels, waffles, etc. I have to say, I am tired of places having a selection of only 1% or 2% milk. Especially when they serve (slightly watery) oatmeal, which deserves cream or at least regular milk. Close to lots of stuff if you need to be in North Phoenix - right at the Black Canyon Conference Center.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reveiws would lead you to believe”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the nearby Courtyard and wasn't overly impressed so the next time I was in the area I decided to stay at this property. Rooms are fine, decor trendy and hip, HVAC worked fine. Flat screen TV. Very good internet connection. Room and linens clean. Housekeeping seemed good. Rooms have a clothes rack vs. an actual closet and there is a single drawer bureau that doubles as a TV stand. Rooms have a strange shape, which breaks up the room nicely, but also makes it difficult where to put suitcases etc. if you have multiply travelers in your room. The lobby area is going through a remodel which has relocated the breakfast area and business center. No big deal but I believe that hotels should be required to disclose this information to anyone making a reservation. The breakfast looked weak and unappetizing and due to the remodel you get the pleasure of eating it in two emptied guest rooms filled with tables. Other than the remodel issues I would stay at this property and it's conditions are much improved than previous reviews would indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GrandySandi
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of friends (7 rooms) from Oct 27-30. We got a supposedly group rate, but the rate on the web site was the same as the one we got. It was a good rate, but this was a case pretty much of "you get what you pay for." We do not normally stay in Marriott Hotels, but decided to go with what the group was doing. All in all, it wasn't too bad. We arrived after 3:00 which is supposed to be check-in time, but our room wasn't ready so we had to wait for a bit. They are redoing the lobby, so that area is boarded up. The boarded up area also includes the breakfast area. It seems as though the remodel is to last until December. Seems like a long time for a remodel so it is possible it will be finished before then. Check their web site for information on this if you plan to stay here. The rooms were fine, nothing special but not bad either. They had really decent pillows, which is usually not the case. They appeared to have been updated recently. The breakfast was not worth much in my opinion. They had sausage, what I call "plastic" scrambled eggs, waffles and assorted juices, cereal, bagels, english muffins and a sweet roll. Because of the lobby and breakfast area being remodeled, they had the breakfast set up in what used to be the fitness center. So, no fitness center. Also, the waffles were in a separate room which was not very convenient. They have converted two rooms into rooms for eating breakfast and one of these rooms holds what they call the business center--a computer and printer. All in all, it was not a bad experience. I would recommend this hotel to friends, if breakfast was not important. For the price you could probably eat breakfast elsewhere. By the way, the hotel calls itself "SpringHill Suites by Marriott Phoenix North, not Metrocenter Mall/I-17 as shown on this site. May have been a name change?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - Good experience..”
Reviews.Author: abqwolfe
Reviews.Content: Good grief, did we stay at the same place as the person who said it was dirty? Our room, the grounds, the pool, the breakfast area, everything we saw was neat and clean. We were four adults who chose the hotel for location and to use reward points - but we were not disappointed. From check-in to check-out our experience was great - the staff was awesome (thanks Charles, Perla and Thomas) and the accommodations were perfect. Our room was clean and neat and every request (extra towels, etc) was met immediately. We stayed three nights and there were several young sports teams in the hotel every night - we never heard the kids, and when we ran into them in the breakfast room in the morning, they were extremely polite young people (even when their parents, coaches weren't there). We had a wonderful experience and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the property to others and would stay again if we were in the area. We were so impressed that we've booked a Marriott Springhill Suite in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and screwed up hotel”
Reviews.Author: therealmike
Reviews.Content: I will spare you a long story on this. It's a slightly below-average springhill, but with horrible management, particularly in housekeeping. One evening I returned to find a note on my door that my carpet had been cleaned and that the floor would be wet. The room was hot, damp and smell, and yes, the carpet was wet. And the beds were unmade, and there had been no maid service. It is WEIRD to clean the carpet when there is a guest in the room. I spend 150 nights a year in hotels and this has never happened. But worst of all, I caught the maids hand washing the glasses in the room. Becoming suspicious of the maids, I marked the glasses I had soiled, and came back that night to find the same glasses "cleaned" probably with my dirty towels by the person who scrubs toilets. DISGUSTING. And ILLEGAL. Breakfast is lousy as well. STAY AWAY. I will!

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be part of the Marriott system”
Reviews.Author: CorelliArizona
Reviews.Content: I had requested a feather-free room with the reservation. I had to wait 20 minutes for the room to be prepared, and in the meantime the front desk was left unattended as apparently there was only 1 attendant on duty at 8:30 pm. While waiting, I noticed the extremely dirty carpeting in the halls and the overwhelming "aromatherapy" fan in the poorly-equipped fitness room, which made it impossible to use. The hotel is right next to the freeway, the windows are not doubled, and there is no way to keep the ventilating fan on constantly to serve as gray noise. The fan is only on if you are heating or cooling the room AT THAT MOMENT. The room doors close extremely loudly, so I was awakened each night by late arrivals at 1:00 a.m. Will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABQLLV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while driving to San Diego. The place was clean and in the process of being completely renovated; our room already was renovated. The beds were comfortable, even the pullout. The pool was small, but we had it to ourselves and our kids really enjoyed the break from the Phoenix heat. The free breakfast was okay - waffles, bagels, cereal, juice, overcooked eggs. The kids liked it more than my husband and me. There were lots of other restaurant options nearby. Small but friendly staff. Nice location, right off the highway, but it was confusing to get to the hotel off the highway - it is on a one way road that runs along the highway and it is easy to miss the turn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bella349
Reviews.Content: Please note that I am a Travel Agent and I am rating this on the category of hotel that this property falls in. Although I have given 5 stars it is not a high end resort, but a great value for this price level.My husband & I stayed at the SpringHill Suites as a stop over on our way to Prescott. The check in process went very smoothly thanks to a young lady named Crystal who was working the front desk.  She was very pleasant and more than helpful answering all of our questions.The room was very clean with nice decor and the bed VERY comfortable. It was also nice to have a mini fridge available. If we were staying longer I am sure that we would have appreciated the microwave as well.Although we did not use the pool we did sit at the pool area, it was also very clean.Our most pleasant surprise came in the morning when we went down to the lobby area for the continental breakfast. It consisted of eggs, sausage, Belgian waffles, bagels, toast, English muffins, muffins, fresh fruit,  yogurt, cereal, oatmeal,  juices, coffee, tea ,hot chocolate  . All of this was being refilled and attended to by a young man named Dantre. He was very efficient and greeted all the guests with a big smile and a "Good morning". Internet was free in the rooms as well as a computer station in the lobby area.  A nice touch since we had recently stayed at a Hyatt property and had to pay for the Internet even after spending 400.00 a night for the room!! If I had to give any negative it would be a double edge sword comment about the location. The best part about the location was it was right off of  I-17, very convenient  to get on and off if you are heading up to Sedona, Prescott, Grand Canyon. The worst part about the location was it was right off of  I-17, so although the rooms were some what sound proof all the public areas, such as the pool , were noisy from the traffic.I would not let that deter me from ever staying there again though because all in all it was a great place and an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Exalent Staff,”
Reviews.Author: tllind1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days for a funural, we wanted to stay close to the family there and did not know a thing about this hotel/suite. everything from the reservations to ck out was very easy and staff was kind, friendly, and very cheerful and helpful. I have never ever stayed at a place that has such a great staff, everyone of them had a smile and wanted to help. I felt right at home there. The location was easy to get to and clean large rooms. Anything we needed they would accomadate us. They even offered to get us food earlyer then 6:30am if we needed to leave before that if we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: CRW99
Reviews.Content: We liked the price and location. The staff was truly excellent. The room was clean and well maintained. Great breakfast. We left a camera, and the maid gave it to the hotel lost and found and the camera was mailed to our address. We will stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you don't want Internet Access”
Reviews.Author: bw0
Reviews.Content: The number deal breaker with this place is the Internet, it has issues, it seems to be a re-occurring problem based on other TripAdvisor reviews. Other then internet from time to time the rates on this place drop and can be a real good deal overall. What to expect for the complementary breakfast: Pillow Eggs, Hard Boiled Eggs, Sausage, Cereal, Milk, Juice, Waffles, Assorted Breads, Fruit, oat meal. The pillow eggs are real scary, they are perfect round circles made in a factory somewhere, they taste okay, but I hate to think what kind of additives are in those. Sausages are super greasy, extra cheap and could probably rival the additives in the eggs. The Good: - Suite style room - Sometimes has great rates - Fitness trail right next to the hotel - Close to allot of restaurants (Sweat Tomatoes and Souper Salad are in walking distance in case you are feeling guilty about your artificial breakfast foods) - Comfortable beds - Breakfast while fake offers items you don't normally find at hotels like this - Clean The Bad: - Non-usable Internet - Room layout is such that you will most likely trip over the coffee table coming in or out of your room - Design is a little tired and has a bunch of typical cheap hotel furniture (except the bed). - If you get a room on the far end, it is a hike to the elevator - The remote in my room was for a different brand of TV and was not compatible with my TV.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: markcas123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 08 for about a week on business in Phoenix. Despite some very minor complaints I gave this hotel five stars for service. The friendliness of the staff at this hotel is excellent across the board. The cleanliness of the rooms and the efficiency of which the housekeepers do their work is superior to any hotel I have stayed at. The only place where the staff was consistently more friendly was at the Cozumel Palace in Cozumel Mexico. The hotel and rooms are kept very clean and if you want fresh sheets each day you are there, you place a little card on the bedsheets. You might think you automatically get clean sheets ever day you stay at any given hotel but you would be sadly mistaken. The breakfast for a continental offering is outstanding with little "egg patties" Sausage, Cereal, Bagels, Oatmeal that you can add nuts, raisins and Cinnamon to, Three juices(Lemon, Orange, and Apple) The Wireless internet in your room works consistently, although slow. You can't surf pictures or send large documents but I never had a problem logging on. The property is safe, well kept and clean although next to highway 17. There are three well known franchise restaurants on the same road as the hotel with a mall across the highway with 3 or 4 main franchise restaurants and a full mall. The area outside the block of the hotels is a little depressed with some pan handlers but I never felt unsafe. I was asked for money or food a few times and when I said no, I was told "thank you anyway, god bless!" I would definitely stay here again when in phoenix. Although I would rather stay somewhere with a restaurant and a bigger breakfast, the service level of this hotel make up for any minor complaints I might have.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Janner1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April before driving up to the Grand Canyon. We arrived very late at night due to a delayed flight. The hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport, right off I-17. We went right to bed and fell asleep quickly in the very comfortable beds and quiet hotel. The five of us fit very comfortably since the sofa pulled out to a bed. The free breakfast was much more than we expected. They had belgian waffles, pancakes, oatmeal, muffins, cereal, etc. They even had containers to take food to go if you were in a rush. There is a nice outdoor pool, but we did not have time to use it. Overall it was the perfect place for an overnight stay, and the free breakfast was nice since we needed to get on the road quickly in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, yeah, we've been having problems with the Internet.”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, and probably would've ranked higher save for one problem -- a very big problem for a business traveler. When I checked in at 8 p.m. I went immediately to eat, figuring I would work when I returned. That was a mistake because their wireless Internet was completely worthless. First, you need a password, which is nowhere to be found. After calling the front desk to get it, I set out to connect. The signal was very weak and kept cutting in and out. At some points it was so weak that Windows couldn't repair the connection. What looked like a wired option (an outlet marked "modem") did nothing. It was too late by then to do anything about this -- and I was too angry to sleep. Rather than stay the second night I checked out, and the nice young fellow asked if something was wrong. I told him exactly what was wrong, and how having no viable Internet for a business traveler is like not having a bed. His response: "Oh, yeah, we've been having problems with the Internet." Beyond that, the room was big, though a nighlight that was part of the hair dryer couldn't be shut off and cast a glow on the bed all night. The breakfast buffet was ample. I'm at the Fairfield Inn in Mesa now, where this review is proof that the wired Internet access works. This is also a much nicer area. For a few bucks more, you can do better than this SpringHill.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lumasabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites (2 adults 2 kids) for 1 night on our travels to the Grand Canyon. Our room was very clean and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The beds were extremely comfy and our room was reasonably quiet. Continental breakfast provided was good too with plenty to choose from. We found the free internet very useful so we could check our email without having to have brought our own computer with us. Plenty of good local restaurants/diners nearby at the Mall although I would not recommend the Black Angus where we ate! Terrible service and very average food for the price. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who is after a comfy bed, clean room and friendly service, all at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: evans7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting our sons at a nearby university. We have stayed here a number of times in the last few years and find it to be a convenient location for us. The hotel staff is the friendliest! Very clean hotel with good size rooms. The breakfast is well stocked and has a nice variety of choices. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected from a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrooklineGuy
Reviews.Content: Initially I got a bit lost trying to find the hotel but that is because I did not follow my directions properly. Once there, I found the suite small but clean and comfortable. The beds and pillows were great. I can usually tell how good a hotel is by the number of complaints I get from my wife. She was quite happy with this one and actually complimented me for making a good choice. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was even better. I didn't expect the variety of choices I had and was surprised to find sausages and eggs as part of a complimentary breakfast. You won't find that in most hotels. I dont know when I will be coming back to Phoenix but when I do, this will be my first choice in hotels for both comfort and price.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good-great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwarrior
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel for directions. I almost missed the driveway but the directions were accurate. The lobby area/front desk is small but had a cozy feel to it expecially with the fireplace! Most of the lobby had dining tables which I learned were for the provided breakfast. Check in was informative and polite. (This was my first time staying in an all suite hotel and I guess I had a picture in my mind of what the suite would look like.) Upon entering the room my first impression was "this is it?" My eyes passed the living room and went right to the windows in the back . Once I reoriented myself, I found that the suite was somewhat tight in the living area. The work table and the kitchen area was expansive. The couch, sitting chair, ottoman, TV and coffee table were cramped in a small area. The furniture appeared to be on the edge of being worn and of cheap quality.It was clean and in order. The bedroom area was fine; tons of pillows and comfortable beds. The bathroom area was fair and they forgot to put out soap/shampoo etc. I had to go to the desk for some. Rooms were quiet for a good night's sleep. In the morning we had the included breakfast: everything from waffles to yogurt to cereal to eggs to muffins- totally super! The presentation was extremely appetizing and filling. After my critical view of the room the breakfast won my vote! I guess you can't have everything and since everyone's expectations are different, the experience there was above average and will give it a go in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. I was in Phoenix for business and it was nice coming back to a room that was clean, cool (maid made sure to have air on for me), and comfortable. The rooms are big and the beds are extremely comfortable. The breakfast has many delicious choices. The only opportunity I would list for this hotel is the business center's computer is a little too tight with the security program. I was unable to change spreadsheets, or log into my work computer. I was only able to use it for basic needs. Then had to find an alternate computer in Phoenix to use.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: davejostef
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights while in Phoenix. It was a bear to find the first time 'round, as it's on a frontage road and we had to double back (twice) to figure out how to get to it. Once you get the route down, it's no problem. It is right NEXT to the freeway so noise is an issue. May be less of a problem is you get a room facing away from the freeway. The room was OK. They call them suites but they are pretty small with only a half wall between the living room and bedroom. Bed was comfortable and we had FOUR pillow to choose from. The window air conditioner didn't really cool the room as much as we would have liked. In hindsight, we should have opted for a room on the first (cooler) floor. Only downside to the room, walking on the carpet made white socks black (Eewww!). Many folks used the pool and husband went in the spa but I thought the spa looked a little grungy and took a pass. Breakfast choices were good but we looked for more fresh fruit than was offered (only bananas and rock hard pears). We also liked the in room high speed, wireless internet access. A big plus! All in all, It was nice ... just remember, keep your shoes on!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag, good overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and well maintained. Comfortable beds and everything works. Exterior is well kept. However, be sure to 2x or 3x check your reservations as they get lost sometimes. TV news limited to CNN, which is irritating. Breakfast does not start on time. Coke machines empty constantly. Often it is the details that make a business trip a pain or a joy. At this hotel, be prepared to do it yourself. Front desk people are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awkward Location”
Reviews.Author: rockchalktraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice mid-priced hotel in the Phoenix area and of course, every room is a suite which is very nice. The pool is small but heated and it does have an exercise room which is also nice. Continental breakfast is O.K. and it does have a wi-fi connection for your laptop. It is conveniently located off of 1-17 but since it is located on a one way frontage road it is a bit awkward to get to and to get back on the interstate. Overall it is a nice, well run and clean establishment. There are several nice chain restaurants real close by and it is only about 10 mintues from downtown.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites Phoenix Metrocenter Mall/I-17
HotelInfo.Address: 9425 North Black Canyon Freeway, Phoenix, AZ 85021
